section.title: Product Overview
section.para: Project Management requires the ability to account for the hours and expenses related to a Project. While these capabilities are critical to Project Management, they're even more important to a business operating in the Service industry. Manufacturing companies have had many tools available for product costing and profitability reporting for decades. The Time and Expense extension delivers a comparable level of reporting required by services businesses.

Time and Expense provides service-based functionality on top of the foundation of xTuple ERP. In addition to the features found in Time and Expense, you also have access to the full range of advanced ERP features—such as accounting, inventory management, and Customer relationship management (CRM).
Here are just a few real world examples of how Time and Expense can help you:

varlistentry.term: Budget management by Project and Task

listitem.para: Time and Expense will enable you to report budget vs actual information for a Project and Task. Requiring hours and expenses to be assigned to a Project and Task can greatly enhance your ability to manage costs and Project margins.

Capturing service billing in a routine manner allows for faster invoicing. The ability to enter detailed notes on each time or expense line provides supporting documentation, which fosters better communication and faster cash receipts.

Employees can enter expenses and associate them to a Project. A manager can then use the Approval process once they've reviewed the entries. Expenses can then be automatically vouchered and a payment processed.

section.para: This Time and Expense Product Guide will walk you through the process of installing, configuring, and using Time and Expense for your service billing and expense reporting needs.

section.title: Choosing an xTuple ERP Edition
section.para: Time and Expense is available for use by all three xTuple ERP editions: PostBooks, Standard, and Manufacturing. This means you will have full-scale ERP functionality underlying your Time and Expense installation.

If you are uncertain which xTuple ERP edition is the right one for you, our sales staff would be happy to help you make your decision. To contact us, simply send an email requesting more information to sales@xtuple.com.

section.title: Open Source Software: What is it and what does it mean to me?
section.para: By now you may have heard some buzz about open source software—and you're not sure what to make of it. It may even sound like a bunch of technical jargon used to impress IT professionals, which may or may not apply to yourself. This is all the more reason why we want to provide you with a little insight into what open source software is and what it means to you.

In a nutshell, open source software provides users with access to software source code. By source code, we mean the programming files that form the basis for a software product. Open source software is different from closed source software, in that closed source software locks up its source code and hides it from end users. Traditionally, closed source software has been the more common form of commercial "boxed" software products that you would pick up at your local office store. A result of the open source movement has been several licensing and distribution models:

listitem.para: Applications are free to anyone and developed as Projects in large groups based on public input.
A combination of free and commercial applications. A company may provide some software tools that are free to the public, while others are sold commercially.
Commercial software where the source code may be viewed; however, there is no ability to make changes to the code.

note.para: xTuple software generally falls under the second category: "dual license." That's because we offer both free and commercial applications, with our source code available for review and change.

section.para: Still wondering what all this means to you? Well, what it means is that the software we've created has grown based on direct feedback from YOU, our user community - whether you're a paying Customer or not.

At xTuple, we don't hide our work from public scrutiny. Rather, we present our work for all to see. We do this to promote shared insight into how we can continue to improve the software to make your job easier. In fact, on the xTuple community website we encourage you to provide direct feedback regarding bugs you've found or features you may find useful in the future. We also invite you to share your success stories and tips and tricks. In this way, you can reach out and help other xTuple community members.

And, If you are an IT professional and a bit of a code jockey, you can even make changes to the source code on your local copy. Many of our greatest enhancements have been sponsored by our Customers—and these changes have been rolled into the final product so that other users can benefit from the improvements. This means our tools and products are not designed solely by xTuple engineers. They are also designed by the people who use them everyday. We at xTuple encourage you to learn more about the community and get involved on the xTuple.org website. Rather than quietly grumbling to yourself about things you think could be better, reach out to fellow community members to find out how to make these changes happen!

section.title: xTuple Application Architecture
section.para: The xTuple applications are designed on a two-tier system:

listitem.para: Graphical client built using the open source Qt development framework
Database server running on the open source PostgreSQL database

section.para: All of the xTuple business logic resides in the database, so there is no middle tier (i.e., Java/application server). And the client is "thin": since Qt and the PostgreSQL database are cross-platform solutions, the application can be installed on Mac, Windows, or Linux machines—in any combination you prefer.

Installation of xTuple is easy and painless. Once you download the software, you then run the xTuple graphical client out of the directory it resides in. The same xTuple client can connect to a database for any of the xTuple ERP editions: PostBooks, Standard, or Manufacturing. Upgrading from one edition to the next involves little more than running a two-minute script on your database. The simplicity of the upgrade process illustrates the point that xTuple maintains a single code base for all of its ERP editions. Doing so enables our community of open source users to share and work together in one online hub for all the xTuple products.

There are several layers of security available with xTuple ERP. You can utilize a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) connection, and you can also enable an enhanced authentication mechanism which scrambles your users' passwords. In addition, you can also assign individual privileges with the system in as much detail as you see fit for your operation.
